Aloha ##first_name[ACLU Supporter]##,

Bringing private, for-profit prisons to Hawai'i is up for debate! On Wednesday, March 14, the House Committee on Economic Development & Business will hear S.B. 2705 S.D. 2, a measure that would open the door to private, for-profit prisons and jails operating on our shores. Private prisons profit from mass incarceration, which almost always results in civil liberties violations. We need your help to stop these harmful bills from passing.

Send a message to the House Committee on Economic Development & Business urging them to oppose S.B. 2705 S.D. 2.

This bill would allow state agencies to enter into arrangements with private, for-profit corporations to design, build, operate, and maintain jails, prisons, and other public safety services – without necessarily obtaining approval from the Legislature or any elected official first.

The experience of Hawai'i and other states amply shows that handing over control of corrections to for-profit corporations is a recipe for civil liberties violations including abuse, neglect, and misconduct.

Take action today to stop private, for-profit prisons and jails from coming to our shores.

Finally, please share this e-mail with any friend or ally who may share your concerns about private prisons operating in Hawai'i and ask them to get involved!

Sincerely,

Joshua Wisch
Executive Director
